What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I improved my Indonesian language skills. Topics covered included gender & sexuality, colonization, and spirituality/religion in Indonesia.
Incredibly thorough understanding of Indonesian language & culture!

To adaptively learn to write and speak fluently in Bahasa Indonesia for different contexts -- formal, semi-formal colloquial. Respectfully dissecting and examining the cultural nuances of Indonesian culture that guide our worldviews and practices: gender, sex, history of colonialism and mental health.

Bu does an incredible job of allowing her students to have an immersive learning environment. I learned so much about the culture and the language of Indonesia. Not only does she give us the tools we need to communicate, but also an abundance of history that makes engaging in the course easy. It is also fascinating to learn about how the minds of Western people differ from Eastern and our perspectives of everyday life.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Indo at Yale is great! If you've made it as far as this level, you already know that :)

Generally, only mild feedback would be potentially making sure all materials make it to the Canvas page. Otherwise, strengths are everything. Great teacher who is willing to adapt to her students' interests!

Strengths: Conversational class. lots of speaking in Indonesian. Speak about really interesting Indonesian cultural topics. Trip to NYC to visit some local Indonesian run businesses.
Weaknesses: none

Strengths: Professor Dinny. She has such a beautiful soul and super clever mind that shaped our class into an active discussion arena that respected everyone's comments, stimulated intellectual growth and became a place we all wanted to go to every week.

This course could meet more! At such a high level it would be incredible to have a group discussion twice a week. maybe allowing the upper levels to go and talk to the lower level classes would be a great immersion.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes! this course is super interesting and covers topics that will open your eyes to how eastern cultures see the world
Couldn't recommend enough. If you've taken the 6 Indonesian language courses before this, you should take this.
YES! Professor Dinny is the most amazing Professor, and you get to learn so much about Indonesian culture, history and practice your communicative skills in various forms and tones.
Absolutely. My favorite class at Yale.
